title: 49er Ricky Pearsall shot in chest amid robbery in SF Union Square
body_text:
San Francisco 49ers wide receiver Ricky Pearsall was shot in the chest during a robbery in Union Square late Saturday afternoon.
Pearsall, the 49ersâ€™ first-round pick in the latest NFL draft, was rushed to San Francisco General Hospital where he is in serious but stable condition, according to a team statement.

The suspect, a 17-year-old from Tracy, was immediately apprehended and arrested by police. During the struggle, the suspect was also shot and is currently being treated at the same hospital, police reported.
Board of Supervisors President Aaron Peskin said he was briefed by a police captain who confirmed that Pearsall resisted his assailant, resulting in the suspect being wounded with his own gun.

Police Chief Bill Scott confirmed at a press conference that only one firearm was involved and the suspect acted alone, noting that no evidence suggests Pearsall was targeted for being a football player. He declined to specify the item the suspect attempted to steal.
â€œWe have a good idea (but) weâ€™re not ready to release that at this time,â€ Scott said.
The 49ers issued a statement expressing that Pearsall was in serious but stable condition.

â€œWe ask that you please respect his privacy at this time. Our thoughts and prayers are with Ricky and the entire Pearsall family,â€ it added.
John Lynch, the 49ers' general manager, is at the hospital to support Pearsall, a team source said. Members of the 49ers' medical, security personnel and player engagement staff were also at the hospital.
Mayor London Breed described the incident as a "terrible and rare occurrence" for Union Square, emphasizing San Francisco's relatively low violent crime rates but acknowledged that â€œthe data goes out the window sometimes when something happens like this.â€
Despite this, police presence in the area will be increased.
The San Francisco Fire Department reported that the first 911 call about shots fired came in at 3:28 p.m. on Saturday.

Witnesses reported hearing shots and seeing people running and screaming. A Union Square security guard saw a man run into the Diptyque store carrying bags, followed by the sound of three shots.
A witness reported being at a Kearny Street stoplight when he heard about five shots and saw six women running. He saw Pearsall with blood streaming down his left arm. The witness noted that police ran toward the victim, not the suspect, which he found unusual.
â€œIt was a scary situation,â€ said the witness, who requested anonymity.
Hours after the shooting, five shell casings remained on the ground at Geary and Grant streets. About a dozen police officers surveyed the scene, dusting two Teslas, one black and one gray, for fingerprints.

The city's overall reported crime rate during the first four months of this year was the lowest since at least 2018, according to a May report by the Chronicle.
Recent declines reflect in part a significant drop in reported property crimes and larceny theft, including in the Financial District/South Beach neighborhood, which includes Union Square.
This year the overall crime rate is down significantly: As of Aug. 25, the number of reported crimes had decreased by 33% compared to the same period last year, with robbery reports falling by 22%.
â€œSadly gun violence happens all over America, but when we have one instance of gun violence in Union Square, it gets all the attention,â€ said Peskin, who is also a candidate for mayor. â€œIt is horrible, it is tragic, it is frightening, but it is rare.â€
San Francisco District Attorney Brooke Jenkins said her office is expected to make a charging decision by Tuesday or Wednesday.
In a statement, she expressed gratitude to the police department, saying, â€œWe cannot and will not tolerate senseless crime in San Francisco, and my office will ensure that there is accountability.â€
Pearsall had been signing autographs earlier Saturday at the Cow Palace.
The San Francisco 49ers invested their top selection in Aprilâ€™s NFL draft in Pearsall, a wide receiver from the University of Florida, aiming to provide another target for quarterback Brock Purdy.
However, the 23-year-old faced injury setbacks during training camp. Shoulder and hamstring issues limited him to six of the 19 practices, and he missed all three preseason games.
Pearsall, selected 31st overall, returned to practice on Monday but was still wearing a non-contact jersey and a sleeve on his left shoulder during Thursdayâ€™s final practice of the week. His status for the season opener on Sept. 9 against the Jets at Leviâ€™s Stadium remained uncertain.
49ers players expressed relief that Pearsall was in stable condition. Wide receiver Deebo Samuel posted on X (formerly Twitter) on Saturday, â€œHeâ€™s good. Thank God.â€

Other contenders in San Francisco's mayoral race condemned the violence and emphasized the need for safer streets, reflecting the communityâ€™s concern and desire for change.
Daniel Lurie denounced the â€œsenseless violence,â€ while Supervisor Ahsha SafaÃ­ tweeted that the shooting was â€œdeeply troubling.â€
Mark Farrell, in his tweet, stated: â€œEnough is enough. If we want public safety in San Francisco, then we need change in City Hall.â€
Chris Navalta, a San Francisco resident, sports memorabilia collector, and lifelong 49ers fan, drove to the Cow Palace on Saturday to see Pearsall.
â€œHe had been injured during preseason and training camp, so this was the only time we got to see him in any capacity,â€ Navalta said.
Pearsall signed his rookie card shortly after 1 p.m. and expressed his appreciation to Navalta, saying, â€œThanks for coming out today.â€
The two took a photo together, and Pearsall mentioned that he too was a gamer, like Navalta, who works in the video game industry.
Navalta left the show by 2 p.m., and by that time, Pearsallâ€™s table had cleared out.
Hours later, Navalta read about the shooting.
â€œI was absolutely shocked,â€ said Navalta, who lives near Union Square. â€œIt also hit a nerve for me. I lost my nephew to gun violence 10 years ago, so hearing that he had been shot literally just hours after I had interacted with him really shocked me to my core.â€
Eric Branch, Matthias Gafni and Warren Pederson contributed to this report.
